metadata.title: Piaggio P.180 Avanti
aws::graph::propositions: # Piaggio P.180 Avanti Variants
P.180 Avanti is the first production variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti.
P180 M is a military version of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti.
P180 M has a combination passenger/freighter configuration.
P180 M is used as a VIP transport.
P180 M is used as a light utility transport.
P.180 RM is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti for use in radio calibration.
P.180 AMB is an air ambulance variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti.
P.180 APH is an aerial cartography variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti.
P.180 Avanti II is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti with improved avionics.
P.180 Avanti II is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti with improved engines.
P-180 EVO+ is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti with 400kt TAS.
P-180 EVO+ is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti with higher useful load.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) was initially called Maritime Patrol Aircraft.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) is a variant of the Piaggio P.180 Avanti II.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) has a larger wingspan than the Piaggio P.180 Avanti II.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) has bigger fuel tanks than the Piaggio P.180 Avanti II.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) uses Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-66B engines.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) uses Hartzell five-blade scimitar propellers.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) electronics include the Albatros mission system from Saab Group.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA) electronics include Pro Line Fusion avionics from Rockwell Collins.

text:
## Variants

P.180 Avanti
First production variant.
P180 M
Military version with a combination passenger/freighter configuration for use as a VIP and light utility transport.
P.180 RM
Variant for use in radio calibration.
P.180 AMB
Air ambulance variant.
P.180 APH
Aerial cartography.
P.180 Avanti II
Variant with improved avionics and engines.
P-180 EVO+
Variant with 400kt TAS and higher useful load.
Multirole Patrol Aircraft (MPA)
Initially called Maritime Patrol Aircraft, MPA is a variant of the Avanti II with a larger wingspan and bigger fuel tanks. As with the EVO propulsion system, MPA uses more powerful Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-66B engines and Hartzell five-blade scimitar propellers. MPA electronics include the Albatros mission system from Saab Group and Pro Line Fusion avionics from Rockwell Collins.
